summary.long: 1 Peter is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ,
To the refugees scattered throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification by the Spirit, for obedience and sprinkling with the blood of Jesus Christ:
Grace to you and peace be multiplied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to His abundant mercy has given us a new birth into a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to an incorruptible and undefiled inheritance that does not fade away, kept in heaven for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who are protected by the power of God through faith for a salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this you greatly rejoice, even though now, if for a little while, you have had to suffer various trials,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that the genuineness of your faith, which is more precious than gold that perishes, though it is tried by fire, may be found to result in praise, glory, and honor at the revelation of Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom, having not seen, you love; and in whom, though you do not see Him now, you believe and you rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: receiving as the result of your faith the salvation of your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning this salvation, the prophets who prophesied of the grace that should come to you have inquired and searched diligently,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: seeking the events and time the Spirit of Christ, who was within them, signified when He foretold the sufferings of Christ and the glories to follow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was revealed to them that they were not serving themselves but you, concerning the things which are now reported to you by those who have preached the gospel to you through the Holy Spirit, who was sent from heaven—things into which the angels desire to look.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore guard your minds, be sober, and hope to the end for the grace that is to be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As obedient children do not conduct yourselves according to the former lusts in your ignorance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as He who has called you is holy, so be holy in all your conduct,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because it is written, “Be holy, for I am holy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you address as Father the One who impartially judges according to each one’s work, conduct yourselves in fear during the time of your sojourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you know that you were not redeemed from your vain way of life inherited from your fathers with perishable things, like silver or gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was foreordained before the creation of the world, but was revealed in these last times for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through Him you believe in God who raised Him up from the dead and gave Him glory, so that your faith and hope might be in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since your souls have been purified by obedience to the truth through the Spirit unto a genuine brotherly love, love one another deeply with a pure heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you have been born again, not from perishable seed, but imperishable, through the word of God which lives and abides forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For
“All flesh is as grass,
    and all the glory of man as the flower of grass.
The grass withers, and its flower falls away,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but the word of the Lord endures forever.”
This is the word that was preached to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore put away all wickedness, deceit, hypocrisy, envy, and all evil speaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As newborn babies, desire the pure milk of the word, that by it you may grow,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if it is true that you have experienced that the Lord is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Coming to Him as to a living stone who is rejected by men, but chosen by God and precious,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you also, as living stones, are being built up into a spiritual house as a holy priesthood to offer up spiritual sacrifices that are acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For also it is contained in the Scripture,
“Look! I lay in Zion
    a chief cornerstone, elect, precious,
and he who believes in Him
    shall never be put to shame.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, to you who believe, He is precious. But to those who are disobedient,
“The stone that the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and,
“A stone of stumbling,
    and a rock of offense.”
They stumble because they are disobedient to the word, to which also they were appointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God’s own possession, so that you may declare the goodness of Him who has called you out of darkness into His marvelous light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In times past, you were not a people, but now you are the people of God. You had not received mercy, but now you have received mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dearly beloved, I implore you as aliens and refugees, abstain from fleshly lusts, which wage war against the soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Live your lives honorably among the Gentiles, so that though they speak against you as evildoers, they shall see your good works and thereby glorify God in the day of visitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Submit yourselves to every human authority for the Lord’s sake, whether it be to the king, as supreme,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or to governors, as sent by him for the punishment of evildoers and to praise those who do right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is the will of God that by doing right you may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As free people, do not use your liberty as a covering for evil, but live as servants of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor all people. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honor the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Servants, be submissive to your masters with all fear, not only to the good and gentle, but also to the harsh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is commendable, if because of conscience toward God a person endures grief, suffering unjustly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what credit is it if when you are being beaten for your sins you patiently endure? But if when doing good and suffering for it, you patiently endure, this is favorable before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to this you were called, because Christ suffered for us, leaving us an example, that you should follow His steps:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He committed no sin,
    nor was deceit found in His mouth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He was reviled, He did not revile back; when He suffered, He did not threaten, but He entrusted Himself to Him who judges righteously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He Himself bore our sins in His own body on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live unto righteousness. “By His wounds you were healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you were as sheep going astray, but now have been returned to the Shepherd and Guardian of your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise you wives, be submissive to your own husbands, so that if any do not obey the word, they may be won without a word by the conduct of their wives,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as they see the purity and reverence of your lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not let your adorning be the outward adorning of braiding the hair, wearing gold, or putting on fine clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let it be the hidden nature of the heart, that which is not corruptible, even the ornament of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is very precious in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in this manner, in the old times, the holy women, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being submissive to their own husbands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even as Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord. You are her children as long as you do right and are not afraid with any terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, you husbands, live considerately with your wives, giving honor to the woman as the weaker vessel, since they too are also heirs of the grace of life, so that your prayers will not be hindered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, be all of one mind, be loving toward one another, be gracious, and be kind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not repay evil for evil, or curse for curse, but on the contrary, bless, knowing that to this you are called, so that you may receive a blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For
“He who would love life
    and see good days,
let him keep his tongue from evil,
    and his lips from speaking deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let him turn away from evil and do good;
    let him seek peace and pursue it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Who is he who will harm you if you follow that which is good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even if you suffer for the sake of righteousness, you are blessed. “Do not be afraid of their terror, do not be troubled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts. Always be ready to give an answer to every man who asks you for a reason for the hope that is in you, with gentleness and fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have a good conscience so that evildoers who speak evil of you and falsely accuse your good conduct in Christ may be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is better, if it is the will of God, that you suffer for doing good than for doing evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Christ also has once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, so that He might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh, but made alive by the Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by whom He also went and preached to the spirits in prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who in times past were disobedient, when God waited patiently in the days of Noah while the ark was being prepared, in which a few, that is, eight souls, were saved through water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Figuratively this is like baptism, which also saves us now. It is not washing off the dirt from the body, but a response to God from a good conscience through the resurrection of Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who has gone into heaven and is at the right hand of God, with angels and authorities and powers being made subject to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, since Christ has suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves likewise with the same mind, for he who has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that he no longer should live the rest of his time in the flesh serving human desires, but the will of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in earlier times of our lives it may have sufficed us to do what the Gentiles like to do, when we walked in immorality: lusts, drunkenness, carousing, debauchery, and abominable idolatries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are surprised that you do not join them in the same excess of wild living, and so they speak evil of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will give account to Him who is ready to judge the living and the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason the gospel was preached also to those who are dead, so that even though they might be judged according to men in the flesh, they might live according to God in the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The end of all things is near. Therefore be solemn and sober so you can pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Above all things, have unfailing love for one another, because love covers a multitude of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Show hospitality to one another without complaining.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As everyone has received a gift, even so serve one another with it, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone speaks, let him speak as the oracles of God. If anyone serves, let him serve with the strength that God supplies, so that God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom be praise and dominion forever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beloved, do not be surprised at the fiery ordeal that is taking place among you to test you, as though some strange thing happened to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But rejoice insofar as you share in Christ’s sufferings, so that you may rejoice and be glad also in the revelation of His glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you are reproached because of the name of Christ, you are blessed, because the Spirit of glory and of God rests upon you. On their part He is blasphemed, but on your part He is glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let none of you suffer as a murderer, or a thief, or an evildoer, or even as a busybody.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet if anyone suffers as a Christian, let him not be ashamed, but let him glorify God because of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the time has come for judgment to begin at the house of God, and if it begins first with us, what shall the end be for those who do not obey the gospel of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And
“If the righteous one is scarcely saved,
    where shall the ungodly and the sinner appear?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, let those who suffer according to the will of God entrust their souls to a faithful Creator, while continuing to do good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I exhort the elders who are among you, as one who is also an elder and a witness of the sufferings of Christ as well as a partaker of the glory that shall be revealed:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shepherd the flock of God that is among you, take care of them, not by constraint, but willingly, not for dishonest gain, but eagerly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not lord over those in your charge, but be examples to the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the chief Shepherd appears, you will receive a crown of glory that will not fade away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Likewise you younger ones, submit yourselves to the elders. Yes, all of you be submissive one to another and clothe yourselves with humility, because
“God resists the proud,
    but gives grace to the humble.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Humble yourselves under the mighty hand of God, that He may exalt you in due time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cast all your care upon Him, because He cares for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be sober and watchful, because your adversary the devil walks around as a roaring lion, seeking whom he may devour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Resist him firmly in the faith, knowing that the same afflictions are experienced by your brotherhood throughout the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after you have suffered a little while, the God of all grace, who has called us to His eternal glory through Christ Jesus, will restore, support, strengthen, and establish you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Him be glory and dominion forever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the help of Silas, whom I consider to be a faithful brother to you, I have written briefly, exhorting you and testifying that this is the true grace of God in which you stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The church that is at Babylon, elect together with you, greets you, and so does Mark, my son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Greet one another with a kiss of love.
Peace be with all you who are in Christ Jesus. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
